**AI Assistant:**
Well, setting `proofprotocol` to 2 (PROOF_CHAINID) has a specific effect. It means that only the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins. So, not just anyone can create new coins in "mycoin". The control is limited to the designated chain ID controller.

Does that make sense? Do you have any other questions about this setting or "mycoin" in general?
What are the implications of setting `proofprotocol` to 2 in "mycoin"?
No, not anyone can mint new coins in "mycoin". Setting `proofprotocol` to 2 (PROOF_CHAINID) means that only the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins.

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":33, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":20000'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
